theory.brief: Comprehensive practice covering: Verbs of liking/disliking + gerund, Comparative adverbs, Compound and complex sentences with conjunctions
examples: She runs faster than me. (comparative adverb)
I study hard, so I get good grades. (compound sentence)

exercises.original: I like doing puzzles in my free time.
exercises.answer: I enjoy doing puzzles in my free time.
acceptedAnswers: I enjoy doing puzzles in my free time
I enjoy doing puzzles in my free time.
hints: Keep the same V-ing form after 'enjoy'
